snippet: Officials in California have already battled 1,400 wildfires this year, twice the number they would respond to in the same period in a normal year.
abstract: Firefighters in California are battling nearly three dozen blazes that have forced more than 23,000 people from their homes, weeks before normal fire season begins; extended drought and winds blowing toward coast fuel dire predictions of worst year yet.

byline.contributor: Ian Lovett contributed reporting from San Marcos, Calif., and Fernanda Santos from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: Officials in California have already battled 1,400 wildfires this year, twice the number they would respond to in the same period in a normal year.

headline.main: Fire Season Starts Early, and Fiercely
headline.print_headline: Fire Season Starts Early, and Fiercely
